DOC.brief_summary: This study examine whether implementation outreach program employ tracking/reminder/recall/home visit strategy impact receipt immunization preventive care among urban adolescent .
DOC.detailed_description: Outreach worker place 9 primary care pediatric family medicine practice throughout one urban area . Adolescent patient 9 practice identify randomized two group ; ( 1 ) receive outreach intervention Year 1 study ( 2 ) receive outreach intervention Year 2 study . Randomization stratify practice site , patient age , patient gender . After randomization , list Year 1 subject distribute appropriate outreach worker . The outreach worker track immunization status 11-15yo patient within practice , identify patient eligible yet receive immunization recommend age group ( MMR , Varicella , Hepatitis B , HPV , Meningococcal Conjugate , Tdap ) and/or well child visit within past year , attempt connect patient medical care three level outreach activity . First level outreach activity involve contact parent/guardian patient telephone . Outreach worker attempt inform patient 's parent/guardian need immunizations/preventive visit facilitate schedule medical appointment . If unable successfully complete task telephone contact , outreach worker initiate second level outreach activity - contact mail . If contact mail unsuccessful , third intense level outreach activity implement . The outreach worker attempt notify patient 's parent/guardian need immunization/preventive appointment visit patient 's list home address . During visit , outreach worker attempt inform parent/guardian recommend immunization , provide information pertain immunization , facilitate appointment scheduling , assist patient compliance schedule medical appointment Interventions direct towards subject Year 1 group cease 15 month outreach activity . A chart review intervention control group conduct determine immunization well child visit rate within two group . At time , tracking/reminder/recall/home visiting strategy employ Year 1 group repeat Year 2 subject .
